sen.j: 土岐 頼康（とき よりやす、文保2年（1318年） - 嘉慶 (日本)元年/元中4年12月25日 (旧暦)（1388年2月3日））は南北朝時代 (日本)の有力守護大名。
sen.e: Yoriyasu TOKI 1318-February 3, 1388 was a dominant Shugo Guardian Feudal Lord in the period of the Northern ad Southern Courts (Japan).

Yoriyasu TOKI (1318-February 11, 1388) was a dominant Shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: カッコ追加、ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、andのスペルミス修正、Shugo Guardian Feudal Lord→Shugo daimyoとし、補足を追加しました。(用語集参照)
sen.e: Yoriyasu TOKI (1318-February 11, 1388) was a dominant Shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 土岐氏の一族土岐頼清の六男。
sen.e: He was the sixth son of Yorikiyo TOKI from a family of the Toki clan.
He was the sixth son of Yorikiyo TOKI from a family of the Toki clan.
He was the sixth son of Yorikiyo TOKI from a family of the Toki clan.

sen.j: 初代守護土岐頼貞の孫。
sen.e: He was a grandchild of Yorisada TOKI, the first Shugo (provincial constable).
He was a grandchild of Yorisada TOKI, the first Shugo (provincial constable).
He was a grandchild of Yorisada TOKI, the first Shugo (provincial constable).

sen.j: 官位は、従四位下、昇殿、大膳大夫。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), being admitted to the court and daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).
His official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), being admitted to the court and daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).
His official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), being admitted to the court and daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).

sen.j: 父頼清の陣没後、叔父土岐頼遠とともに若くして各地を転戦して南朝 (日本)方と戦った。
sen.e: After Yorikiyo died during a war, with Yorito TOKI, his uncle he moved from place to place to fight against the southern Court (Japan) at many places.
After Yorikiyo died during a war, with Yorito TOKI, his uncle he moved from place to place to fight against the Southern Court (Japan) at many places.
After Yorikiyo died during a war, with Yorito TOKI, his uncle he moved from place to place to fight against the Southern Court (Japan) at many places.

sen.j: 康永元年（1342年）、土岐氏惣領の頼遠が光厳天皇に狼藉を働いたため処刑されると、惣領を継ぎ美濃国守護となった。
sen.e: In 1342, Yorito, the soryo (heir) of Toki clan assaulted Emperor Gokogon and was executed, so Yoriyasu became took over the soryo position and became the Mino no kuni Shugo (provincial constable) of Mino Province.
In 1342, Yorito, the soryo (heir) of the Toki clan assaulted Emperor Kogon and was executed, so Yoriyasu took over the soryo position and became the Shugo of Mino Province.
sen.cmt: the Toki clanとし、Emperor Gokogon→Emperor Kogon、became took over→took overに修正、「美濃国守護」の表記を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1342, Yorito, the soryo (heir) of the Toki clan assaulted Emperor Kogon and was executed, so Yoriyasu took over the soryo position and became the Shugo of Mino Province.

sen.j: 本拠を革手城に移し、美濃の豪族斎藤氏を服従させた。
sen.e: He relocated his headquarter to Kawate-jo castle and brought Saito clan, a powerful regional clan in Mino Province to submission.
He relocated his headquarter to Kawate-jo Castle and brought the Saito clan, a powerful regional clan in Mino Province to submission.
sen.cmt: Kawate-jo Castle、the Saito clanとしました。
sen.e: He relocated his headquarter to Kawate-jo Castle and brought the Saito clan, a powerful regional clan in Mino Province to submission.

sen.j: 土岐氏一族が南朝と結んで反乱を起こすがこれを打ち破って美濃を平定している。
sen.e: Once the Toki family carried out a revolt in cooperation with the Southern Dynasty but Yoriyasu won the battle and suppressed Mino Province.
Once the Toki family carried out a revolt in cooperation with the Southern Court but Yoriyasu won the battle and suppressed Mino Province.
sen.cmt: the Southern Dynasty→the Southern Courtに修正しました。
sen.e: Once the Toki family carried out a revolt in cooperation with the Southern Court but Yoriyasu won the battle and suppressed Mino Province.

sen.j: 頼康は「桔梗一揆」と呼ばれる土岐氏一族の強力な武士団を有しており、観応の擾乱では征夷大将軍足利尊氏を常に支持して武功があり、その功績によって観応2年（1352年）に尾張国守護職を与えられた。
sen.e: Yoriyasu had a strong armed group, called Kikyo ikki (uprising) from the Toki family and always made military contributions and supported for Takauji ASHIKAGA, the seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") during Kanno Disturbance, so he was awarded Owari no kuni no kami (governor of Owari Province) in 1352.

Yoriyasu had a strong armed group, called Kikyo ikki (uprising) from the Toki family and always made military contributions and supported for Takauji ASHIKAGA, the Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") during the Kanno Disturbance, so he was awarded Shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) of Owari Province in 1352.
sen.cmt: seii Taishogun→Seii Taishogunに修正、the Kanno Disturbanceとし、Owari no kuni no kami (governor of Owari Province)→Shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) of Owari Provinceとしました。(用語集参照)
sen.e: Yoriyasu had a strong armed group, called Kikyo ikki (uprising) from the Toki family and always made military contributions and supported for Takauji ASHIKAGA, the Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") during the Kanno Disturbance, so he was awarded Shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) of Owari Province in 1352.

sen.j: 文和2年（1353年）、南朝方に攻められた足利義詮が後光厳天皇を奉じて京都を脱出すると領国の揖斐郡小島に迎えている（｢美濃行幸｣）。
sen.e: In 1353, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA was attacked by the Southern Dynasty side and escaped from Kyoto with Emperor Gokogon, then Yoriyasu welcomed them at Kojima, Ibi-gun Country.
In 1353, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA was attacked by the Southern Court side and escaped from Kyoto with Emperor Gokogon, then Yoriyasu welcomed them at Kojima, Ibi County.
sen.cmt: the Southern Dynasty→the Southern Court、Ibi-gun Country→Ibi Countyに修正しました。
sen.e: In 1353, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA was attacked by the Southern Court side and escaped from Kyoto with Emperor Gokogon, then Yoriyasu welcomed them at Kojima, Ibi County.

sen.j: 文和3年（1354年）に評定衆に列する。
sen.e: In 1354, he was ranked with hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State).
In 1354, he was ranked with hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State).
In 1354, he was ranked with hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State).

sen.j: 延文3年（1358年）に尊氏が死去すると出家して善忠と号した。
sen.e: After Takauji passed away in 1358, he entered into priesthood and called himself Zenchu.
After Takauji passed away in 1358, he entered into priesthood and called himself Zenchu.
After Takauji passed away in 1358, he entered into priesthood and called himself Zenchu.

sen.j: 延文5年（1360年）に伊勢国守護職を与えられ、頼康は東海道の要衝3ヶ国の守護を兼ねて土岐氏の最盛期を築き上げた。
sen.e: In 1360 he was awarded director of Ise Province position, so Yoriyasu became the Shugo of three important provinces in Tokai-do Road and Toki clan enjoyed the most prosperous time.
In 1360 he was awarded Shugoshiki of Ise Province position, so Yoriyasu became the Shugo of three important provinces in Tokai-do Road and the Toki clan enjoyed the most prosperous time.
sen.cmt: director of Ise Province→Shugoshiki of Ise Province、the Toki clanとしました。
sen.e: In 1360 he was awarded Shugoshiki of Ise Province position, so Yoriyasu became the Shugo of three important provinces in Tokai-do Road and the Toki clan enjoyed the most prosperous time.

sen.j: 文武に優れ勅撰和歌集に多くの和歌を残している。
sen.e: He was very strong busho and also talented at making a Waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and his works were included into Chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).

He was a very strong busho and was also talented at making a Waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and his works were included into Chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).
sen.cmt: very strong busho→a very strong busho、talented→was talentedとしました。
sen.e: He was a very strong busho and was also talented at making a Waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and his works were included into Chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).

sen.j: 頼康は尊氏以来の宿老として幕政に参与して重きをなした。
sen.e: As a syukuro (a chief vassal of a samurai family) who served Takauji, he contributed to shogunate administration and was given an important post.
As a shukuro (a chief vassal of a samurai family) who served Takauji, he contributed to the shogunate administration and was given an important post.
sen.cmt: syukuro→shukuroに修正、the shogunate administrationとしました。
sen.e: As a shukuro (a chief vassal of a samurai family) who served Takauji, he contributed to the shogunate administration and was given an important post.

sen.j: 三代将軍足利義満のとき管領細川頼之と対立して勝手に本国へ帰国し、将軍義満から追討令を受ける。
sen.e: At the time of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun, he was opposed to Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, the shogunal Deputy and went back to his province without permission, then Yoshimitsu gave an order to track down and kill, so Yoriyasu apologized and was forgiven and back to government.

At the time of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun, he was opposed to Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, the shogunal deputy and went back to his province without permission, then Yoshimitsu gave an order to track down and kill him.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」余分なスペース消去、the shogunal Deputy→the shogunal deputy、track down and kill→track down and kill himに修正しました。
sen.e: At the time of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun, he was opposed to Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, the shogunal deputy and went back to his province without permission, then Yoshimitsu gave an order to track down and kill him.

sen.j: が、謝罪して許され政権に復帰している。
sen.e: However, Yoriyasu apologized and was forgiven, and he was back to government.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」so→However、and back→, and he was backとしました。
sen.e: However, Yoriyasu apologized and was forgiven, and he was back to government.

sen.j: 康暦元年（1379年）の康暦の政変において斯波義将と共謀し、義満に進言して政敵の細川頼之を追放させた。
sen.e: During Koryaku Coup in 1379, colluded with Yoshimasa SHIBA he proposed banishment of Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, his political enemy and Yoshimitsu was ousted from power.
During the Koryaku Coup in 1379, colluded with Yoshimasa SHIBA he advised Yoshimitsu to banish Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, his political enemy and Yoriyuki was ousted from power.
sen.cmt: the Koryaku Coupとし、「義満に」→訳漏れのため訳出、proposed banishment of→advised Yoshimitsu to banishとし、Yoshimitsu was ousted from power→Yoriyuki was ousted from powerに修正しました。
sen.e: During the Koryaku Coup in 1379, Yoriyasu colluded with Yoshimasa SHIBA; he advised Yoshimitsu to banish Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, his political enemy and Yoriyuki was ousted from power.
sen.cmt: added a necessary subject, assuming it was the same as the cell above. Added a semicolon between independent clauses.

sen.j: 嘉慶元年（1387年）に頼康が死ぬと、養子の土岐康行が惣領を継いだが、将軍権力の強化を図る義満は勢力の強すぎる土岐氏一族の内紛を画策し、康行は挙兵に追い込まれ、幕府軍の追討を受けて没落した（土岐康行の乱）。
sen.e: In 1387 after Yoriyasu's death, Yasuyuki TOKI, an adopted child took over the soryo position, however Yoshimitsu wanted to aggrandize power of the shogun and plotted an internal conflict in Toki clan to weaken strong influence of Toki clan, Yasuyuki was driven to raising an army but attacked by the army of bakufu and brought to ruin (a rebellion of Yasuyuki TOKI).

In 1387 after Yoriyasu's death, Yasuyuki TOKI, an adopted child took over the soryo position, however Yoshimitsu wanted to aggrandize power of the shogun and plotted an internal conflict in the Toki clan to weaken strong influence of the Toki clan, Yasuyuki was driven to raising an army but attacked by the army of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and brought to ruin (The War of Yasuyuki TOKI).
sen.cmt: the Toki clan、the bakufuとし、bakufuの補足追加、統一事項より、a rebellion of Yasuyuki TOKI→The War of Yasuyuki TOKIとしました。
sen.e: In 1387 after Yoriyasu's death, Yasuyuki TOKI, an adopted child took over the soryo position, however Yoshimitsu wanted to aggrandize power of the shogun and plotted an internal conflict in the Toki clan to weaken strong influence of the Toki clan, Yasuyuki was driven to raising an army but attacked by the army of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and brought to ruin (The War of Yasuyuki TOKI).

sen.j: 甥の土岐頼忠が美濃守護に任じられるが、土岐氏の力は大きく減じ、再び美濃一国の守護に逆戻りしてしまった。
sen.e: Yoriyasu's nephew was assigned to Mino no shugo but power of Toki clan dramatically decreased and returned to the shugo of only Mino Province.
Yoriyasu's nephew Yoritada TOKI was assigned to the Shugo of Mino Province but power of the Toki clan dramatically decreased and returned to the Shugo of only Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 「土岐頼忠」→訳漏れのため訳出、Mino no shugo→the Shugo of Mino Province、the Toki clan、shugo→Shugoとしました。
sen.e: Yoriyasu's nephew Yoritada TOKI was assigned to the Shugo of Mino Province but power of the Toki clan dramatically decreased and returned to the Shugo of only Mino Province.
